intro: Acinodendron hematostemon, commonly known as the blood-stemmed acacia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive red or pinkish stem that becomes more prominent as the plant matures. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its leaves are bipinnate, meaning they are divided into smaller leaflets, giving it a feathery appearance. Acinodendron hematostemon is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
